name: Arthur_Fleming
text:
Arthur Fleming
Arthur Fleming was a lumber baron and an early benefactor to the California Institute of Technology.
Fleming's home was built with lumber imported from the Twin Peaks, Washington area, and was later owned by Jack Parsons, during which time it was known as the Parsonage.
Behind the scenes
Arthur H. Fleming (1856 – August 11, 1940) was a Canadian-American lumber operator, best remembered for donating over $5,000,000 to the California Institute of Technology.
